title: Coding Nights
text: With the aim to improve the coding culture of IITGN and help the students get equipped with the necessary industrial and coding skills, we are introducing coding nights! The event will create a positive competitive environment among the students, leading to healthy competition and great learning outcomes.

title: Coding Nights
text:
Structure:

Coding Contest:
Coding contests often occur on websites like Codeforces and CodeChef. These contests would be used to engage the students. We will consider only individual participation.


Problem Solving Session:
The contests will be followed by a problem-solving session by GRASP. This will help enhance the students’ skills.
The winners (Top 2/3) of each contest will get a special T-shirt.
Some of the Possible Contests: CodeChef Starters, and Div3/Div4 of Codeforces.
CodeChef and Codeforces are one of the most popular platforms for competitive coding. They provide high-quality novel questions. As these platforms are very popular, the problem solutions are also readily available online.
The contests are necessary to upskill. However, these clash with the mess timings. Therefore, we will be serving food and refreshments to the students. This will make it feasible for the students to participate in these sessions.
In this event’s first edition, we aim to conduct four contests.

title: Coding Initiative IIT Gandhinagar
text:
The coding initiative has the following functions:

Work with Student Council to inculcate among students the skills of problem solving through programming and coding.
Organize periodic hackathons and coding competitions among students to impart skills with contemporary tools and software solutions to achieve large scale problem solving.
Encourage students to make prototypes and implement in the institute to inculcate a sense of confidence and a level of responsibility in solving the regular problems of the community and institute.
Use newer technologies such as integrative programming, software stack-based solutions, AI techniques, generative AI, AI solutions on images, Conversational AI, Ethical AI, robotics, large APIs, web based solutions etc.
Work in tandem with student council and encourage them to work for development of such skills.

title: Code Meets Art
text:
Start: 10 Jan 2024
End: 17 Jan 2024




Click on image for higher resolution





Flow of Particles through Fields using color generated from a given image. Makes a beautiful pattern giving the illusion of immersive 3 dimensional visuals.


Prize: Headphones worth Rs 3500 for each member (Total Rs 7000)






This is a halftone image made from a color image using stars of different sharpness and hexagons. It uses the pixel brightness to determine what polygon is to be used at respective places. Look from a distance for better view and experience. Zoom in to view the polygons used.


Prize: Earphones worth Rs 1500 for each member (Total Rs 3000)






We extend our heartfelt appreciation to the esteemed faculty members of the Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) Department at IIT Gandhinagar for their significant contributions that have positively impacted our lives. In recognition of their dedicated efforts, we have crafted a memorial gesture in the form of a cover image for the CSE Department. This cover image incorporates individual portraits of each respected professor, carefully arranged in a mosaic format. A Lal-Minar serves as the background, enriched with a subtle polygraphic touch, symbolizing unity and diversity within our academic community. Through this artistic expression, we seek to convey our gratitude and admiration for our professors’ profound influence on our academic journey and personal development. We earnestly hope that our esteemed professors find this tribute vibrant with the depth of our gratitude and the artistic representation of their impact on our academic community.


Prize: Wireless Mouse worth Rs 800 for each member (Total Rs 1600)









ASCII image of Mona Lisa








This piece is an abstract mirrored art which was made using processing development environment. We have tried to imitate idle scribbling with human-like brushstrokes. Every iteration of the code generates unique artwork. By simply changing certain parameters we can change the essence of the artwork. In the github repository you will find 2 codes: In the first one the brushstrokes are guided by a particle controlled by a physics engine. This stays true to the Code Meets Art ethos of generating an art piece exclusively by code. However to encourage audience interaction we have also added another piece of code wherein the brushstrokes are guided by the mouse pointer.







Team Size up to 2 members
Can use any programming language
You are not allowed to use machine learning based generations. Instead look at the provided samples for inspiration.





Submission Form





Creativity and Originality: How creatively has code been used to create or enhance artistic expression?
Technical Execution: How well is the code implemented to achieve the artistic vision? Is it technically proficient and well-crafted?
Interactivity and Engagement: Does the code-driven artwork engage the audience or user in an interactive and immersive manner?
Innovation and Novelty: Does the use of code push the boundaries of traditional artistic mediums or introduce new ways of experiencing art?
Aesthetics and Visual Impact: How visually appealing and impactful is the final output? Does the code contribute positively to the artistic aesthetics?

title: Code Meets Art
text:
ASCII image of Mona Lisa








This piece is an abstract mirrored art which was made using processing development environment. We have tried to imitate idle scribbling with human-like brushstrokes. Every iteration of the code generates unique artwork. By simply changing certain parameters we can change the essence of the artwork. In the github repository you will find 2 codes: In the first one the brushstrokes are guided by a particle controlled by a physics engine. This stays true to the Code Meets Art ethos of generating an art piece exclusively by code. However to encourage audience interaction we have also added another piece of code wherein the brushstrokes are guided by the mouse pointer.
